III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty
to perform the prescribed functions required by these
administrative rules and in the agency's program statement
and to provide for the continual needs, protection, and
supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A was sexually assaulted by other youth while staff were
not supervising properly.
Investigation The complainant was contacted on 12/18/2024 and no additional
information was provided.
The Chief Administrator was interviewed on 12/11/2024 during
an unannounced, face-to-face visit. She reported being made
aware of the allegations and shared safety planning information
that was implemented as a result of the allegation.
Youth A’s facility Therapist was interviewed on 12/11/2024 during
an unannounced, face-to-face visit. She reported Youth A
disclosed these allegations to her after they had been disclosed
elsewhere. The therapist recalled Youth A stating Youth B had
performed a sexual act on him while they were hiding behind a
door in their pod. She expressed concern about the validity of the
allegations because details about them were not consistent to her,
in her opinion. This was based on Youth A’s initial detail that
Youth B had performed a sexual act on Youth A, and then stating
that he also performed a sexual act on Youth B. She shared Youth
A’s frequent sexual acting out behaviors, including making sexual
comments to youth and staff. Therapist noted Youth A had made
increasingly concerning comments about Youth B, including
sexual comments, prior to the alleged incident
occurring. Therapist noted that this was the first instance of Youth
A expressing alleged victimization of sexual abuse on the part of
anyone else.
2

Youth A was interviewed on 12/11/2024 during an unannounced,
face-to-face visit. He reported the incident occurred about a
month ago with Youth B. Youth A recalled being in the pod with
Youth B in the middle of the day. Youth C was also present, and
he was sitting with Staff 1 at a table across the open area of the
pod. Youth A was standing with Youth B near Youth B’s bedroom
door. Youth A described the door as open about halfway. Youth
A stated Youth B grabbed Youth A’s shirt and pulled him behind
the doorway. Youth A recalled Youth B then pulling up his own
shirt and lowering his pants. Youth A stated he performed a
sexual act on Youth B. Youth A believed this lasted for about five
minutes. Youth B did not say anything during this
interaction. Youth A stated he got up and walked away from
Youth B. During this interaction Youth C and Staff 1 were still
sitting at the same table. Youth A did not believe either Youth C
or Staff 1 would have been able to see what had occurred. Youth
A reported feeling more and more upset about it over the next
couple of days when he finally yelled out that this occurred while
in the pod with the rest of the youth placed with him, and then he
told Therapist directly what had occurred. Youth A stated he has
not had any contact with Youth B since the incident or when he
disclosed what had occurred.
Youth A’s Foster Care worker was interviewed over the phone on
12/18/2024. He reported Youth A disclosing the allegations with
him around the same time Youth A had reported the concerns to
Therapist. The Foster Care worker recalled Youth A reporting to
him that no one else was in the pod altogether when the incident
occurred, and Youth B performed a sexual act on Youth A as
opposed to the opposite. He also noted that the rest of what was
reported was consistent with the original allegations presented for
this investigation, in that Youth A was the victim of sexual assault
on the part of Youth B and that this occurred behind a door to
Youth B’s bedroom, obscuring a possible view of the incident.
Foster Care worker noted Youth A had never mentioned Youth B’s
name during his placement at the facility despite having multiple
incidents involving fighting with Youth B prior to this allegation. He
reported no concern about Youth A’s safety at the facility and
stated that communication about Youth A’s case and this incident
was sufficient.
Staff 1 was interviewed over the phone on 01/29/2025. Staff 1
recalled the situation when Youth A alleged he had been sexually
abused by Youth B. She stated Youth A, Youth B and Youth C
were in the pod with her and she was the only staff present. Staff
1 was sitting at a table with Youth C playing a card game and
3

Youth A and Youth B were standing near the doorway of Youth
B’s bedroom. Staff 1 believed Youth A and Youth B were getting
along well at that time, recalling Youth A lightly tossing a plastic
cup at Youth B and Youth B laughing. Staff 1 recalled Youth A
and Youth B whispering about something at that time, and Staff 1
called out to them to move away from each other so they could
not whisper anything that she could not hear. Staff 1 did not
believe Youth A and Youth B interacted much after she gave them
that directive. Staff 1 noted there was likely no documentation of
what occurred because it was not enough activity to even be
noted in shift logs. Staff 1 denied seeing Youth A and Youth B
participate in any sexual activity. She also denied ever not having
line of sight of Youth A and Youth B as they were near Youth B’s
bedroom briefly and the door to the bedroom was not closed
enough to limit the line of sight of them. Staff 1 also recalled
Youth A coming to her a couple of days later and apologizing to
her, stating that he lied about the incident.
Youth B was interviewed over the phone on 01/31/2025. Youth B
expressed awareness of the allegations because he was informed
of a safety plan that had been put in place to limit the contact
between Youth B and Youth A. Youth B denied he participated in
any sexual activity with Youth A. Youth B stated he was standing
near the doorway of his bedroom interacting with Youth A. Youth
B recalled Youth C sitting at a nearby table with Staff 1. Youth B
did not recall any other details about that instance, stating that
nothing happened. Youth B stated he and Youth A were never
behind his doorway and there was no way Staff 1 would not have
had line of sight of he and Youth A because the door to his room
was open, he and Youth A never went in to his room and that they
were out in the open area of the pod together with Youth C and
Staff 1.
Youth C was interviewed over the phone on 01/31/2025. Youth C
recalled the day when this incident allegedly happened and stated
he was able to see Youth A and Youth B the entire time. Youth C
denied seeing Youth A and Youth B do anything of a sexual
nature, and also stated he did not believe Youth A and Youth B
touched each other in any way. Youth C recalled Youth A and
Youth B talking to each other near Youth B’s doorway to his
bedroom while he was playing cards with Staff 1. Youth C did not
believe anything of note occurred at that moment. Youth C
commented Youth A has made sexual remarks to him prior to and
after this incident occurred.
Video reviewed:
4

• Security camera footage was viewed during an
unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility on
12/11/2024. This footage showed Youth A, Youth B, Youth
C and Staff 1 inside of Pod D. All four individuals could be
seen in the open area of the pod. Youth C and Staff 1 were
playing cards while Youth A and Youth B alternated
between interacting with each other and not. Youth B’s
bedroom door was open, but it appeared that it was open
wide enough that Staff 1’s line of sight would not be
impacted. At no point during this footage was it seen that
Youth A and Youth B participated in any physical contact,
sexual or otherwise.
Documentation reviewed:
• An undated facility safety plan signed by Youth A and his
Therapist was provided and reviewed. This documented
efforts agreed upon to limit the interaction between Youth A
and Youth B.
• Additional facility safety planning was provided and
reviewed. This documentation further outlined the facility’s
efforts to separate Youth A and Youth B, including moving
Youth B’s bedroom away from Youth A and efforts to
ensure that they sit away from each other during meal
times and in the classroom.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per youth and staff
interviews, documentation and video reviewed Staff 1 provided
proper supervision to Youth A and Youth B during the alleged
incident.
CONSULTATION:
Consultation was offered to advised staff to ensure documentation
such as safety plans are clearly dated and it is noted who they are
authored by to ensure that they can be organized and
communicated effectively.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
